knimeNode.name: RawReadManipulator
knimeNode.shortDescription: Node for filtering reads from a fastq/fasta file

fullDescription.intro: Node for the tool RawReadManipulator (written by Jonathan Hoser) to filter reads from a fastq or fasta file. Creates new fastq/fasta file in the same directory.
fullDescription.option: use filter-settings file generated by FastQC coming from the in-port
select a previously generated filter-settings file as generated by the FastQC node
remove adapters from reads (start and end only)- with adapters specified in a comma-separated list (e.g "CAGGTACG,CATTTTAG,AAATTGGAC")
(can be covered by filtersettings), if present reads are trimmed of PolyA/T prefixes/tails, depending on the 5/3 option: 3 will trim 3'-polyA/T, 5 the 5'-polyA/T prefixes.
If average Readquality (mean over all single read-bases quality) is below this threshold X we are to discard this read. Paying attention to potential pairs.
trim reads from the right until quality value above threshold Y is encountered.
reads are trimmed from both sides applying the threshold set in "Trim reads by quality"
In case of paired-end datasets: If set to "Yes", we keep single ends (separatly) if the partner is discarded.

option.name: Discard reads shorter than a given length

fullDescription.option: If after all trimming operations a read is shorter than Z, discard it.
In case of Illumina data: if known, specify the quality encoding. If set to "auto", we will try to make an educated guess.
Only possible in case of Illumina data. Quality encoding will be converted to phred encoding
Specify how many threads should be used
